title: Possible role of a copper complex in the pathogenesis of rheumatoid arthritis.
summary: Clinical and experimental evidence suggest that rheumatoid arthritis may be due to a deficiency in joint fluid of an inhibitor of protein denaturation. ...A deficiency of this inhibitor may permit the nonimmunological alteration of joint fluid IgG to a pseudoimmune â€¦
abstract: Clinical and experimental evidence suggest that rheumatoid arthritis may be due to a deficiency in joint fluid of an inhibitor of protein denaturation. This inhibitor may be a histidine-cystine-copper complex. A deficiency of this inhibitor may permit the nonimmunological alteration of joint fluid IgG to a pseudoimmune complex which could initiate the inflammation and immunological abnormalities of rheumatoid arthritis.
